snippet: Though the relationship between the United States and Russia has grown increasingly tense, none of that stress has trickled down to its playing fields, at least not yet.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column observes that although the relationship between the United States and Russia has grown increasingly tense, none of that stress has trickled down to its playing fields, at least not yet; no hockey zealots were cheering against the United States as it played the Russian team in preliminary-round game and there was no palpable animosity between the teams or their fans.
lead_paragraph: Though the relationship between the United States and Russia has grown increasingly tense, none of that stress has trickled down to its playing fields, at least not yet.

headline.main: A Hockey Rivalry Moves Beyond the Ice
headline.print_headline: A Rivalry Moves Beyond the Ice
